thread.section_title: Australian Business & World Finance News - Yahoo!7 Finance
thread.title: Stocks to watch on Monday

title: Stocks to watch on Monday
text:
Mon, Jul 20, 2015, 8:36 AM AEST - Australia Markets open in 1 hr 24 mins Stocks to watch on Monday AAP – 40 minutes ago 
Stocks to watch on the Australian stock exchange on Monday, July 20: 
LYC - LYNAS - closed steady at 3.8 cents 
Rare earths miner Lynas has more than doubled its annual revenue as its production rapidly increases. 
MTS - METCASH - up 11 cents, or 10.43 per cent, at $1.16 
Struggling grocery wholesaler Metcash has recruited two former senior Coles and Woolworths executives to help lead its turnaround efforts. 
NAB - NATIONAL AUSTRALIA BANK - up by two cents, or 0.06 per cent at $34.34 
National Australia Bank has moved to sell down its remaining stake in its former US subsidiary Great Western Bancorp. 
STO - SANTOS - down six cents, or 0.78 per cent, at $7.66 
Falling oil prices have offset a ramp up in production by energy giant Santos, causing a 19 per cent slide in revenue. @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Baird backs raising GST to 15 per cent AAP 
NSW Premier Mike Baird has backed increasing the GST from 10 to 15 per cent, ahead of a special leaders' retreat …
